Everyone, from the front desk to the shuttle bus drivers were MORE than accomodating!! These folks did everything to make our stay enjoyable. They even changed a couple of folks' room because of a preferred location. Fresh coffee, warm cookies and smiling faces, clean but basic accomodations, what more could you want.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place, very helpful.”
Reviews.Author: Buddy21
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for 4 nights while my Dad was having a heart procedure at the U of Washington Medical Center. The shuttle to the hospital was extremely helpful and the staff was very friendly. The room was clean and had a fridge, microwave and coffee maker. The breakfast provided had plenty of variety to chose from. There were plenty of eating places to walk to and the shuttle made getting around very easy.

Reviews.Title: “Not meeeeeeee!”
Reviews.Author: Averill42
Reviews.Content: This is classed as an hotel but more like a motel, did not feel safe at night, people hanging around outside your rooms, doorlocks broken for entry to parts of the building. Barricaded myself in with s/cases chairs etc. Lesson to be learnt sorry but never again.

Reviews.Title: “worst customer service experience ever!”
Reviews.Author: AK-Traveler04
Reviews.Content: The front desk had four employees on, including the manager and of them only one had any decent customer service skills. The manager was incredibly rude and unprofessional, and confrontational when we told him that we'd been hung up on by his only female front desk person when we called to ask why nobody had come to fix the lack of hot water in our room (after having been told an hour before that someone would be right up). We were shocked at how quickly this manager shoved aside the nice and helpful male clerk to tell us his clerk would never hang up on anyone and that we were obviously lying. He then told us that it was too bad but there was nothing they could do for us and we were wasting his time. We demanded our money back (we'd only been there one night and not one of us had gotten a hot shower!) for the remainder of our stay and were told, "no, if you leave early you pay for the whole five days". We eventually got our money back but had to get very upset in order to do so. Since then we have heard other people talk about bad experiences like this at the same place, when we bring it up there's always someone who's been there and can relate. Small world.

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: McNeils
Reviews.Content: My wife and i stayed at this hotel for four nights. The shuttles that this hotel offers are incrediable. We used them to go to an NFl game, as well as pikes place, space needle and other venues as well. The shuttles made the tyrip because we never had to search for parking. The room was very large. Ask for a top floor room on the back side, these are the quietest rooms. This hotel will be great for travelers wanting a clean room to sleep in. This hotel will not work for people wanting to spend a great deal of time at the hotel , as there are few ammenties. we will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “It's okay”
Reviews.Author: LAH_in_Lansing
Reviews.Content: A very average hotel for the money. The room was very small and it can be a very long walk down the outdoor walkway from your unit to the nearest staircase. The room was clean, however. And the shuttle was a well-appreciated amenity considering the cost of parking downtown. Overall, I probably wouldn't stay here again or recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great for pre and post cruise”
Reviews.Author: rkramadh
Reviews.Content: I did a lot of research online before booking this hotel. I took it for its location and low price, as we needed to be close to the Pier prior to our cruise. There is a huge mall within walking distance and also a Target etc which came in handy for us to pick up some last minute items prior to our cruise. We got free shuttle service to and fro from the pier and the van driver Bruce was friendly, helpful and courteous. The room had two queen beds, small fridge, coffe maker, TV. Room was not fancy but was clean (especially the very clean bathroom) and more than sufficient, particularly given the price of $129 per night in peak summer in Seattle! We took the shuttle even to downtown and got picked up late that night after our dinner...cab would have cost us close to $100 two way!!! It can take time sometimes if they have lots of passengers to pick up and people are not in their designated spot on time. People expecting luxurious hotel in Seattle for THIS price haven't done their research or are not well travelled is my conclusion!

Reviews.Title: “Room ok, breakfast disappointing”
Reviews.Author: eurotourist75
Reviews.Content: As others said, this is not a luxury hotel, so, manage your expectations! I have been to better hotels at a similar price, but it might be that it's Seattle in general that is more expensive... Our room at Nexus (at the back of the hotel, quieter) was clean, modern and spacious, although one may not like the external corridor. We didn't use the free shuttle as the schedule was not convenient to us, but bus 16 runs just outside of the hotel. I know free breakfast is always a plus, but this was disappointing. Food was the same you would get at similarly priced hotels, however the ambience was the thing that really made me realise I was in budget hotel: plain walls, disposable dishes and cutlery, black tablecloths giving an idea of dirt, big black rubbish bins with the lid open... If you care about these things you may prefer to skip the free breakfast at the hotel and go to Starbucks just across the road. Overall, this hotel is not bad, but not exciting either.

Reviews.Title: “OVERPRICED!”
Reviews.Author: cougarpride
Reviews.Content: I stayed a week and regretted it. On the website it seemed modern, but when I got there I was seriously disappointed. It was trying to be something it obviously isn't. It said it was pet friendly, however, when I got there with my two dogs I had no place to walk them. They didnt even provide a patch of grass. So why the pet fee? If you want to go to walk your dog you better be prepared to either walk or drive 2 miles to Green Lake Park, which can be hassle to do in the morning before going to work. The toilet was backed up and despite calling the front desk the afternoon it happened they sent someone the next morning. The shower curtains are so short that the floors get easily wet. The wireless was non responsive...most of the time not even working. I called the internet service provider but even after doing so it never worked. I had to get an ethernet cable. They only offered about five channels and HBO so if you are there for an extended stay you may get a bit bored. The layout of the building was pretty bad too. You can't open the curtains to your room without everyone being able to see in there...no privacy at all. So i had to stay there with the curtains drawn which can get a bit sad. It is also located on a very busy street and I heard sirens mulitple times a day. On a positive note, the breakfast was good, front desk staff were very accomodating with faxes I needed sent or received and the housekeeping staff provided good service and friendly. I was expecting something more for almost $200 dollars a night with a govt rate. For overnight stays it is ok, but anything longer or a person with pets can do better elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Nexus - Great for Seattle visit”
Reviews.Author: ChicagoBruce
Reviews.Content: Spent 2 nights at Hotel Nexus in Early July with my wife and 2 children. We chose it because of the reasonable rates AND the shuttle service provided to downtown. What a convenience! After reading other TripAdvisor reviews I booked a room, requesting the back side of the Hotel. I don't know if was noisy on the street side, but it was quiet as can be where we were. The room was clean and comfortable. The was a small problem with air flow from the air conditioner, but after I called the front desk a member of the engineering staff showed up in ~5 minutes and fixed it. The continental breakfast was good. The best amenity was the shuttle service to points throughout downtown. We were dropped off by the Space Needle in the morning and after a full day sightseeing we walked to a Mariner's game and got picked up south of the ballpark after the game for our return to the hotel. It was great! Parking downtown would have been at least $20 staying in one spot. I'm so glad we stayed at the Nexus and I would do it again. (P.S. tip the shuttle drivers, they're worth it.) Bruce from Chicago

Reviews.Title: “Pros and cons of Hotel Nexus”
Reviews.Author: AKaroundtheworld
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Hotel Nexus from a Thursday afternoon through Sunday morning. There are some good things and some not so good things about this hotel. I chose the hotel primarily for the location and for the fact that they provide a shuttle to the Childrens Hospital (as well as other area hospitals and attractions) where I was visiting. The good things about the location are the proximity to the freeway, and the Northgate mall. Also there is a very good restaurant next door. The bad things about the location are the proximity to the freeway (noisy) and the fact that the hotel is located on a busy road that connects to the freeway. The best thing about the hotel itself was the housekeeping staff. The room was very clean, the housekeepers were friendly and I never woke up to the sound of housekeeping calling to each other or vacuuming next door like I have had in some hotels. In fact, the housekeeping staff were the friendliest people at the hotel. The front desk staff, one in particular, were cold and not so efficient (almost as if they just didnt care) and unfriendly to the point of being rude. I noticed this with all the guests, not just myself. The other not so good things about the hotel was the look from the outside - very like a budget motel, with the rooms on several levels with their entry doors along a corridor on the outside facing the street (which is not always secure) and the outside just had a shabby tired look. One of the most frustrating incidents involved the internet access. The hotel boasts high speed internet in all the rooms. I was able to get online on Thursday but not at all on Friday or Saturday - it seems the hotel was full and the internet was busy and the signal was very weak. It was very frustrating as I was not able to be online again until Sunday morning. The hotel was very noisy, you could hear the guests in all the surrounding rooms, and while this is not the fault of the hotel, I had an upstairs neighbor who paced his floor (my ceiling) ALL NIGHT LONG for both Thursday and Friday night. Overall, I would not recommend this hotel. I was not in one of the premium rooms with the soaker tub however, but for the amenites and room I had here, you could get a room at another hotel for a better price, like an 8 or Motel6.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for the game”
Reviews.Author: Victoria_BCMark
Reviews.Content: My son and I stayed at the Nexus overnight from Victoria BC. The hotel was affordable and perfectly located to get to the game in less than 20 minutes. It is also very close to Northgate Mall where we did some shopping and had a good meal. The room was clean and the staff were very friendly. The parking lot was well lit and safe. It is exactly what you would expect for the price. Great bargain, great location.

Reviews.Title: “perfectly fine”
Reviews.Author: SamPatch
Reviews.Content: Nothing fancy, but slightly better than some of the usual chain motels. Recent construction upgrade probably helped. My room was clean and on the less noisy, non-highway side.

Reviews.Title: “The bad reviews are decieving”
Reviews.Author: blatro
Reviews.Content: The only reason that Im writing this is to object to the bad reviews. This is not a resort hotel and one shouldnt expect it to be. My wife and I were there from Saipan for 8 days to visit family. The heat and hot water were perfect. Everything in the room worked. The room was clean and the cleaning staff were friendly. The location and service was great. Public transporattion is right up the street with a direct bus to the U district and downtown. The hotel van will take you for free to anywhere near their route. Lots of convient shopping and eats nearby. I think that those who write the negative reviews are delusional or expect much more than they are willing to pay for.

Reviews.Title: “Ok, but not a business hotel”
Reviews.Author: ChicagoTrav
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel because it was close to a conference I was attending. I would not choose to stay at this hotel if you need to do business. The wireless network barely worked. The signal was so weak that it did not work properly, even after numerous calls to the internet provider. I ended up having to buy an ethernet cord to use my laptop. Also, my phone did not work the first evening of my stay. But, if you want a clean, no-frills place, this will do. The staff was friendly enough, and the continental breakfast in the morning is pretty good. The hotel is not close to the sights, so I would not find it convenient to stay here if you are sightseeing in Seattle. There is really nothing in the neighborhood and very little within walking distance unless you want to visit a below-average shopping mall down the street. If you have problems walking, make sure you room is near the elevator, which is inconveniently located if you were placed, like me, at the end of the hall on the top floor. I ended up taking the stairs, but if you have bad joints or are out of shape, it is not convenient unless your room is near the elevator.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the hydrotherapy spa”
Reviews.Author: luneytunz
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed my stay, room was clean, had a broken iron, but not a problem. Very busy, close to shopping, and a good complimentary breakfast, from cereal, oatmeal, boiled eggs... The japanese hydrotherapy spa was great, would def rent that room again!!

Reviews.Title: “Not recommended if looking for clean.”
Reviews.Author: Minotmom
Reviews.Content: Carpet was filthy! Our feet and socks were black within minutes of being in room. The walls in the full kitchen suite were splattered with grease or food. Our 17 month old son had to sleep in a second-hand (manager admitted they purchased used from another business), stained, dirty playpen because they do not provide cribs even though their website stated they did. Front desk was lacking. Cabs were not called when they said they would, we did not get a wake up call the morning of our departure when we requested one the night before, and the free shuttle service was slow. Allow plenty of time to get to your destination. It took one hour to get to the Space Needle from the hotel. We understood this was not a 5 star hotel, but when paying almost $200 a night, we hoped things would have been nicer. We will never stay at this hotel again!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Nexus Seattle Washington Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: RoadrunnerAgassiz
Reviews.Content: My wife and I had to go to Seattle, where our daughter had been flown from Vancouver B.C. Canada to give birth to our premature granddaughter. Our daughter had been staying at the Hotel Nexus for approximately three weeks and recommended the Hotel to my wife and myself. Upon calling the Hotel to make reservations the Hotel accomadated our request for a room close to our daughters. Next door in fact. As well the staff were well informed of our daughter and her family. Upon arrival the desk staff were extremely helpful in booking us in, and demonstrated an understanding and knowledge of what was occurring with our daughter and her family and ensured that we were informed while at the same time maintaining confidentaility in regards as to being overheard. We found our Hotel Rooms clean, the pool was in very good condition, and the staff was excellant. I had read previous reviews on the Hotel Nexus which were negative and to be honest I was quite concerned however as I have stated I found the Hotel Nexus to be higher rated than stated.

Reviews.Title: “What a gem”
Reviews.Author: criverz
Reviews.Content: What a gem! We just concluded a perfectly delightful stay at the Hotel Nexus in Seattle, WA. We flew in on a blustery, rainy day, feeling a little bedraggled by a day of traveling, and were immediately warmed and uplifted by the sparkling, personal greetings and reception of the friendly hotel staff. The lobby, and come to discover the rest of the hotel as well, was artfully and tastefully decorated with funky, eccentric, neomodern retro-furnishings, the likes of which I have not seen anywhere else in my travels. In speaking with hotel personnel, they informed me that each piece was handmade exclusively for them by local furniture crafters, and were entirely unique. In our room, the unique and progressive design features continued, and we enjoyed the most comfortable mattress that I have ever slept on. Normally, I make it through a hotel stay with varying amounts of discomfort, but I slept like the proverbial baby and didn't want to get out of that wonderful bed in the morning. All during our stay the staff was extremely helpful, cheerful and genuinely concerned about both our comfort and our "tourist" experience, recommending (without prompting) any number of local attractions and activities. We loved the area and we particularly enjoyed the hotel. We can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Incompetence”
Reviews.Author: lmmidpoint
Reviews.Content: I booked ( on the hotel's own website) a room at this hotel specifically for the hydrospa tub in the room. I was taking a test at the University of Washington the next day and wanted to relax the night before. Upon arriving I was informed that they did not have my reservation and did not have any more tub rooms either. Once I did finally get another room, it was just okay, nothing special. The staffer at check out was a joke, I spent 30 minutes waiting for him to shuffle papers, find things he had but got lost in the mess of papers he had going, and to say that my shuttle reservation was on another sheet of paper and that's why they didn't have that one either. After two trips back to the office to get my key turned back on so I could load my stuff in the car (it was 6:30 am), I ended up missing breakfast because of the runaround. Shesh!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “stay away!!”
Reviews.Author: myfamilyof5
Reviews.Content: We stayed at theis hotel when it was the Ramada Inn a few years back- didn't like it then either We thought they really renovated and upgraded. The website makes it looks good- the only thing nice about it is the lobby. The rooms are small and cramped, yes we are a family with 3 kids but have never had a problem at a Hyatt or other hotels. Aside from that the room looked and felt dirty- when we checked in there were no towels or soap. The bedspreads looked very shabby and when you actually see the covers underneath they has several holes!!- The pillows were a joke- the 1st morning we went out and came back at 2pm- the room hadn't been cleaned- okay- so when they did come in she changed the sheets, not pillowcases, no did she even wipe down the bathroom or sink- Oh yes, when you used the sink it filled up- maybe drano would work- no closet just an area near the bathroom- and yes a plus with microwave and fridge but the area was so tiny, the fride also leaked all over the floor (a nice puddle to step into.) We didn't get a chance to go for the breakfast, so can't comment on that. It is a a very busy street. You can't open the drapes to see light as everyone can see in- The rooms were quite dark-poorly lit. Would not stay there again-

Reviews.Title: “Good value, good location”
Reviews.Author: exiled-scot
Reviews.Content: We last stayed there at the end of August for a couple of nights, as we had stayed there previously. This is a hotel that offers good value and is in a good location for shopping. We found the room very clean, and the bed comfortable. The front desk staff were very friendly and helpful and we would definately stay there again. I can't believe all the negative comments about this hotel our experience was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Loud”
Reviews.Author: Speedy-Vesper
Reviews.Content: Front desk personnel were unfriendly and not helpful throughout the stay. Couldn't sleep, because so close to highway. Public Transport not available

Reviews.Title: “Nightmare on Northgate Way”
Reviews.Author: oahutraveler2
Reviews.Content: We were visiting family close to this location so decided to try it over much nicer hotels in Seattle. The first morning of our stay water started pouring through the light fixture in the bathroom. We called the front desk who suggested that we take a key for a dirty room and use the shower there. I was told that they did not want to give us a key to a room with a clean shower because they would have to re-clean the room. When they finally agreed to allow us to use a clean shower they told us that they did not know when they would be able to fix our room. We were considering checking out when the manager told us that if we stayed the next night that we had reserved she would make sure that we would be taken care of. Although the room was cleaned when we returned, taking care of us was a $10 discount on the room which frankly was less than we tipped the maid. The front desk staff was disinterested and somewhat rude, parking was difficult to find and although they said that the hotell was newly remodeled it still looked like a run of the mill Ramada Inn. It's near a hospital and you will hear sirens all night long. Good luck if you stay here.

Reviews.Title: “New Name-Nexus, Old Hotel Look”
Reviews.Author: kennygH0n0lulu
Reviews.Content: We're out of State visitors to the Seattle region visiting our daughter and stayed at the Ramada Inn @ Northgate for 3 nights which were 3 nights too much. There were a few some pro points about the hotel-near the Northgate Mall and highway on-ramp entrances, free parking and continental breakfasts but the cons over-ruled the pro points. Cons- Check in was messed up with a confirmed reservation for a two double bed room, but front desk told us that they had us for a room with single queen size bed. No bell man to take our baggage to our room. The lobby's single elevator is too small to transport 4 adults with baggages. Room number configuration is confusing-odd number & even number rooms on either side of the building. Strange hotel design-coming out of the elevator where all room doors are exposed to the outside part of the building. Hate to check in this hotel when the temperture is in the 20's-30's. Tiny cramp rooms and out-date furniture- lamp with blue poka dots shade & green plastic swivel chair. Room's only window is fronting tthe corridor preventing privacy. Air conditioning is NOT central air. It's a stand alone a/c unit that is built in the exterior wall under the window. Our a/c unit's control was broken and could only work when the gauge is at the coldest settings. Instead of freezing, we turn the a/c off and slept in a musty but warmer room. The blankets were thin and the bed sheets were stiff, regardless of their claim of upgrading their beds with new Serta beds, our sleep were not restful. The bathroom faucet couldn't give us any warm water when we turned the handle to the middle, it was hot, hot water. The shower head was loose so on our first shower, water sprayed all over the bathroom floor. The name has changed from the Ramada Inn at Northgate to the Nexus, but it's still an out-dated and a budget class hotel that we definitely won't come back to. For a few bucks more, I'd rather stay at a Marriott and enjoy their superior rooms ,service and ameneties. Overall grade for the nexus hotel- D

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Nexus Seattle
HotelInfo.Address: 2140 N. Northgate Way, Seattle, WA 98133
